claim: AI agents will act as junior virtual coworkers across knowledge work; for software, an agent can handle most tasks of a top-company engineer with a few years’ experience (for multi-day tasks) under human supervision, and can be replicated at scales from thousands to millions globally.
explanation: Partly true in direction, but overstated for software today. Evidence shows AI agents already act as junior “virtual coworkers” in some knowledge work at large scale (e.g., Klarna’s AI assistant handled two‑thirds of customer‑service chats, doing the work of ~700 agents), and enterprise copilots/agents are widely deployed. ([klarna.com](https://www.klarna.com/international/press/klarna-ai-assistant-handles-two-thirds-of-customer-service-chats-in-its-first-month/?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) For software engineering, however, current best public evaluations don’t support the claim that an agent can handle “most tasks” of a top‑company engineer on multi‑day work: on SWE‑bench Verified, leading systems are roughly in the 65–72% range on curated issues, and the benchmark’s verified set skews toward tasks under an hour for a human engineer. ([swebench.com](https://www.swebench.com/?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [openai.com](https://openai.com/index/introducing-swe-bench-verified/?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) Long‑horizon, multi‑step reliability remains a problem—errors compound over steps and agents struggle on extended planning tasks. ([businessinsider.com](https://www.businessinsider.com/ai-agents-errors-hallucinations-compound-risk-2025-4?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [arxiv.org](https://arxiv.org/abs/2408.06318?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) Even where “coding agents” exist (e.g., GitHub Copilot coding agent), they are in public preview, positioned for low‑to‑medium complexity tasks, and require human review—far from autonomously handling most multi‑day engineering tasks. ([github.blog](https://github.blog/changelog/2025-05-19-github-copilot-coding-agent-in-public-preview/?utm_source=chatgpt.com)) Replication to thousands‑to‑millions is feasible and happening (e.g., GitHub Copilot has 20M all‑time users; Microsoft says nearly 70% of the Fortune 500 use Microsoft 365 Copilot), but that scale reflects assistant/collaboration tools, not agents that can do most work of experienced engineers unsupervised. ([techcrunch.com](https://techcrunch.com/2025/07/30/github-copilot-crosses-20-million-all-time-users/?utm_source=chatgpt.com), [blogs.microsoft.com](https://blogs.microsoft.com/blog/2024/11/19/ignite-2024-why-nearly-70-of-the-fortune-500-now-use-microsoft-365-copilot/?utm_source=chatgpt.com))
